g.text: Remix "frameworks" the relationship between the Client and Server
App-like Interactions
You can still do Client-Side state if you want
Lots of Shared logic like UI's, validation, etc
Good for SEO
Better opportunity for performance than an SPA
Client-Side Routing
Works without JS if you want
CSS Encapsulation
All Hybrids (Probably)
Remix Specific
All based on standard "fetch" api
Uses manifests instead of big bundles
Code-splitting by default
Probably won't need useEffect much
Don't need as much global context or fancy state managers
First-class nested layouts üòç
Host Remix anywhere that runs JS (Cloudflare v8 Edge)
Remix exposes the "root " of your project to you
ü¶æ
then has "adapters" for things like express or
Vercel. Helps it avoid a clunky "plugin" system
